title: Chinese Government donates 50,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $900,000 in April 2021
description: On April 29, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 50,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina. The estimated monetary value of the donation is $900,000.
staff_comments: 1. According to the UNICEF COVID-19 Vaccine Market Dashboard, the price of a single Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine dose is $18. As such, AidData has estimated the monetary value of the April 2021 donation as $50,000. (https://www.oecd.org/officialdocuments/publicdisplaydocumentpdf/?cote=DCD/DAC/STAT(2022)33&docLanguage=En).
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government donates 50,000 Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $900,000 in April 2021

# Description
On April 29, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 50,000 donated doses of Sinopharm Covid-19 vaccines to the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina. The estimated monetary value of the donation is $900,000.
justification: Project is a healthcare donation with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of Covid-19 vaccines, healthcare focus

title: Chinese Embassy donates biological safety cabinet to Serbian Hospital in East Sarajevo
description: On June 10, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Bosnia and Herzegovina donates a biological safety cabinet (also known as cyto chamber) to the Serbian Hospital in East Sarajevo. The machine aims to help with the treatment of local cancer patients. Previously, the hospital had been using an old device that has undergone many repairs.
combined_text:

title: Sinopharm donates 36 boxes of anti-epidemic materials to Sveti Hospital in January 2021
description: On January 22, 2021, a donation ceremony was held at the Sveti Apostol Luka Hospital in Doboj. The donation by China Sinopharm International Corporation's Central Eastern Europe Branch included 36 boxes of anti-epidemic supplies, containing protective suits and surgical masks, for the mitigation of the spread of COVID-19.
combined_text:

title: Chinese Government donates 200,000 Sinovac Covid-19 vaccine doses worth $3.6 million in April 2021
description: On April 25, 2021, the Chinese Government delivered 200,000 donated doses of Sinovac Covid-19 vaccines to the Government of Botswana.  The Chinese Government pledged to donate an additional 2 million COVID-19 vaccine doses to the Government of Botswana in 2022.
staff_comments: 1. According to the UNICEF COVID-19 Vaccine Market Dashboard, the price of a single Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine dose is $18 (https://www.oecd.org/officialdocuments/publicdisplaydocumentpdf/?cote=DCD/DAC/STAT(2022)33&docLanguage=En). As such, AidData has estimated the monetary value of the April 2021 donation as $3.6 million.
combined_text:

justification: Project is focused on healthcare through vaccine donation, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of 200,000 Sinovac Covid-19 vaccine doses, healthcare focus

title: Chinese Embassy donates anti-epidemic supplies to Botswana Ministry of Health in August 2021
description: On August 4, 2021, the Chinese Embassy donated a batch of Covid supplies to the Botswana Ministry of Health. The donation included an unknown quantity of oxygen generators and ventilators. The purpose of the project is to help Botswana fight the COVID-19 epidemic.

title: Chinese Embassy donates medical supplies to Sidilega Hospital in Botswana in August 2021
description: On August 16, 2021, the Chinese Embassy donated medical supplies to Sidilega Hospital in Gaborone, Botswana to help support the hospital's anti-COVID-19 efforts. The contents of the donation are CPAP machines, oxygen concentrators and thermometers. The medical supplies were handed over by Chinese Ambassador Wang Xuefeng and his team.
combined_text:

The contents of the donation are CPAP machines, oxygen concentrators and thermometers. The medical supplies were handed over by Chinese Ambassador Wang Xuefeng and his team.
justification: Project is a donation of medical supplies with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical supplies donation, healthcare sector, COVID-19 support

title: Chinese Embassy donates drone to Botswana Ministry of Agricultural Development and Food Security in August 2021
description: On August 26, 2021, the Chinese Embassy donated a drone to Botswana's Ministry of Agricultural Development and Food Security to aid the country's agricultural sector. The drone was handed over by  Ambassador of the People's Republic of China to Botswana Wang Xuefeng.

title: Chinese Embassy donates electronics and anti-epidemic supplies to Botswana Ministry of Education and Skills Development in May 2021
description: On May 31, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Botswana donated 50 radio and CD players, 50 computers, and 10,000 face masks to Botswana's Ministry of Education and Skills Development. The donation will support the Botswana Ministry of Education's prevention efforts during the COVID-19 pandemic.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title

# Description
On May 31, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Botswana donated 50 radio and CD players, 50 computers, and 10,000 face masks to Botswana's Ministry of Education and Skills Development. The donation will support the Botswana Ministry of Education's prevention efforts during the COVID-19 pandemic.
justification: Project focuses on educational support and pandemic response without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of electronics and anti-epidemic supplies to education ministry, COVID-19 prevention focus

title: China provides the Chinese Government Scholarship for Botswana citizens in 2021
description: The Government of China offered Chinese Government Scholarship for eligible citizens of Botswana in the 2021/2022 school year for a master degree, doctoral degree, general scholar or senior scholars. The scholarship amount and the number of recipients remain unknown, and scholarship recipients would study in China for one to two years

title: China donates anti-epidemic materials to Botswana in August 2021
description: On August 5, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Botswana, the United Nations Population Fund in Botswana and the Ministry of Health and Wellness jointly held the handover ceremony of China's anti-epidemic personal protective materials. The US$60,000 PPE includes 1,900 isolation gowns, 20 boxes of examination gloves, 40 boxes of surgical gloves, 40 boxes of surgical masks, 1,650 goggles, 1,980 face shields and 1,900 coveralls, which will be used to protect frontline workers amid the third wave of the COVID-19 pandemic.   This donation is a project carried out by China and the United Nations Population Fund under the framework of the South-South Cooperation Assistance Fund.
staff_comments: Since the breakdown of the donation value is not known between the Chinese Embassy in Botswana (an official Chinese agency) and the United Nations Population Fund (not an official Chinese agency), AidData estimates the official portion as half the total value (US$60 thousand), so US$30 thousand.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China donates anti-epidemic materials to Botswana in August 2021

# Description
On August 5, 2021, the Chinese Embassy in Botswana, the United Nations Population Fund in Botswana and the Ministry of Health and Wellness jointly held the handover ceremony of China's anti-epidemic personal protective materials. The US$60,000 PPE includes 1,900 isolation gowns, 20 boxes of examination gloves, 40 boxes of surgical gloves, 40 boxes of surgical masks, 1,650 goggles, 1,980 face shields and 1,900 coveralls, which will be used to protect frontline workers amid the third wave of the COVID-19 pandemic.   This donation is a project carried out by China and the United Nations Population Fund under the framework of the South-South Cooperation Assistance Fund.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for public health purposes, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of personal protective equipment (PPE) for COVID-19 response, including isolation gowns, gloves, masks, and other protective gear
